name: punishing sb by sending them sw else

children.name: to make sb leave a country
expel
children.definition: to make a foreigner leave a country because they have broken the law, or for political reasons: trục xuất
examples: The new government banned books, seized passports, expelled foreigners, and legalized detention without trial.
The new government has expelled all foreign diplomats.
expulsion[C or U noun]
When war was announced the government called for the immediate expulsionofall foreign journalists from the country.

children.name: expel from
examples: Two foreign diplomats were expelled form Ethiopia on March 31.

children.name: deport
children.definition: to force someone to leave a country, especially someone who has no legal right to be there or who has broken the law : trục xuất ngoại cảnh
examples: Thousands of illegal immigrants are caught and deported every year.
deport from/ to
The man has been deported back to the Irish Republic where he will face terrorism charges.
Several football supporters were deported from Italy during the World Cup.
The refugees were deported backtotheir country of origin.
deportation[C or U noun]
The US government has ordered his deportation.
There weremassdeportations in the 1930s, when thousands of people were forced to leave the country.
deportee[ C ] người bị trục xuất
a person who has been, or is waiting to be, deported

children.name: repatriate
children.definition: to officially send sb back to their home country, often by force and against their will: trục xuất về nước
examples: Italy is using military helicopters to repatriate 292 Albanian refugees.
There was to be a cease-fire, and all prisoners of war were to be repatriated.
The government repatriated him because he had no visa.
repatriate war refugees to their homeland.

children.name: to make sb leave their own country
exile
children.definition: / send sb into exile to make sb leave their country for political reasons, for example because they oppose the government and are fighting against it: bị đày, lưu vong
examples: The leader of the coup was exiled and the others imprisoned.
The Prince and his family were sent into exile after the revolution.
exile[C noun] kẻ lưu vong, viễn xứ
a radio station run by Cuban exiles in the United States
live/be in exile[VP] sống lưu vong
For many years she lived in exile in France.
The kingwent intoexile because of the political situation in his country.
The deposed leaders are currentlyinexile in the neighbouring country.
exiledadjective
the exiled king

children.name: banish
children.definition: to send sb away permanently from their country or from the area where they live, as an official punishment: đày đi

children.name: banish to
examples: Napoleon was banished to the island of St Helena in 1815.
He was banishedtoan uninhabited island for a year.

children.name: to send sb to the country they have committed a crime
extradite
children.definition: to officially send sb back to another country where they are believed to have committed a crime, in order to be tried in a court of law : dẫn độ (ai đến nước họ đã phạm tội)
examples: The drug baron was extradited to the United States from Colombia.
Spanish authorities are seeking to have the couple extradited to answer further charges.
He will be extraditedtoBritainfromFrance.
extradition[C or U noun]
The US government is seeking the extradition of the two men to face charges in the 2001 hijacking attacks.
They have applied for his extraditiontoIreland.
an extraditiontreaty
extraditable[adj] describes a crime for which a person can be extradited, or a person who can be extradited : có thể bị dẫn độ
an extraditable crime/offence
